page.title: 17STREAMS AND MILLS KEMBERTON
page.content: At Kemberton there was another mill. The mill house is dated 1648. It is thought to have been the site of an 18th century charcoal blast furnace. Later it was used for paper making then corn grinding. Operations stopped about 1902. Further south is Hinnington Mill built in 1874. About 1889 its owner, Colonel Kenyon-Slaney, installed a pump to draw water from a spring to fill a reservoir which served his Hatton Grange Estate. The building has a printed sign 'Hinckesman's Spring Brewery'. In the 1890s, Hinckesman, who rented the mill, sold reconstituted beer there. The mill is now a house. In the south-east corner of the parish is Grindleforge. It is known that there have been a forge, a slitting-mill and a paper-mill there.
